The ninth is ceding the two routes of Liaodong and Changchun. The tenth is returning the three great kings of the Jurchen A-gu to their country. Tianzuo was handed over to the ministers for discussion.
Xiao Fengxian was greatly delighted.
He considered that from then on there would be no trouble.ğŸ”½He appointed Jingjiang Military Commissioner Xiao Xilie and Hanlin Academician Yang Mian as the envoys to seal and present the edict.
The vice envoy was Guizhou Circuit Surveillance Commissioner Zhang Xiaowei, and the vice envoy was Taichang Shaoqing Wangfu, who was in charge of mutual inquiries.
The vice envoy was Weiwei Shaoqing Liu Shi, who was in charge of the officials in charge of gifts.
The director of the Bureau of Construction Yang Zhuzhong was appointed as the reader of the edict.
The Son of Heaven's ceremonial robes, jade seal, golden seal, carriage, and ceremonial vehicles were all provided.
He established Aguda as the Eastern Huai State's Most Sacred and Most Enlightened Emperor.
The contents of the edict briefly stated:
We think with affection.
The area of Xiao Shen is
truly the customs of Fu Yu.
The land borders the upper country,
and the talent spreads throughout the rugged middle.
He has the reputation of mountains and rivers, inheriting the lineage of his father and ancestors.
In the vast wilderness of blue clouds, he must certainly stand out with his talent.
In the flying frost of white snow, who would not consider him to be unmatched?
The chapter on enfeoffment is repeatedly reported,
and sincerity is mutually trusted.
Thinking of the distant fragrance, he should receive much favor.
Therefore, we send Xiao Xi Lie and others
to hold the ceremony and prepare the gifts.
He is enthroned as the Eastern Huai State's Most Sacred and Most Enlightened Emperor.
Righteousness is sincere and friendly,
and the land is fertile.
Alas! Let us revere and praise him!
The auspicious title is bestowed in accordance with his virtue.
The ancestral title was changed to the Most Sacred and Most Enlightened.
The rest followed suit.
He ordered people to set out in the tenth month.
In the winter, in the twelfth month, they reached the Jin state.
In this month, Aguda posthumously honored the ancestral shrines of nine generations,
Posthumously bestowing the title of Jingyuan Emperor on the first ancestor.
The eighth ancestor was named Erlu and posthumously titled De Emperor.

The seventh ancestor was named Yanghai and posthumously titled An Emperor.ğŸ”½The sixth ancestor was named Suikuo and posthumously titled Dingzhao Emperor, also known as the founding ancestor.ğŸ”½The fifth ancestor was named Shiru and posthumously titled Chengxiang Emperor, also known as the illustrious ancestor.
The great-great-grandfather, the grand mentor named Hulai, was posthumously titled Hui Emperor, also known as the Jing ancestor.
The father, the great master named Yangge, was posthumously titled Xiao Ping Emperor, also known as the Muzong.
The empresses were all posthumously titled in the Jin history.
Aguda showed Yang Puxian the ceremonial gifts from the Liao.
Yang Puxian used the ceremonial gifts that were not complete according to the system of the Son of Heaven.
Moreover, Dong Huai Guo was a small state that cherished the virtue of the Liao.
There is no text for the elder brother.
It is not a good idea to have a distant fragrance and many flowers.
The red bow and elephant carriage are also matters for feudal lords.
The two characters talent seem to be contemptuous.
He ordered to study the text of Lie Gui and change it.
Lie Gui said:
The elder brother is friendly and the younger brother is respectful, which comes from the Book of Zhou.
If it is said to be friendly and harmonious, then the elder brother's opinion is clear.
Yang Piao and others refuted it face to face, saying it was not right.
Aguda became very angry.ğŸ”½He scolded the envoy and wanted to have him beheaded.
The tribes of Qiehan apologized and he released him.
However, each person was still whipped more than a hundred times.
In the following year, in the third month, he only sent Xiao Xilie and Yang Lichen back, saying:
I do not understand the inscription at all.
The honorific titles, national title, king's carriage, and imperial treasures, I have them all.
You must address me as the elder brother of the Emperor of the Great Jin State.
If you can follow me, you can come to the front of the army this autumn.
Otherwise, I will lead troops to take the capital.
Emperor Tianzuo hated hearing about the Jurchen affairs.
Xiao Fengxian guessed his intentions and did not report them.
Procrastinating for a long time,
he heard that the capital had already fallen and the peace talks were thus canceled.
Later, although Emperor Tianzuo repeatedly spoke of peace,
Aguda did not respond to the Liao.

In the Jiashen year, the first year of Xuanhe, the ninth year of Tianqing in the Great Liao, the second year of Tianfu in the Great Jin, the first year of Yuande in the Western Xia, in the second month, an edict was issued to change the Buddha to the Great Enlightened Golden Immortal.
The rest were called immortals and great virtuous ones.
Monks were called virtuous ones.
Nuns were called virtuous women.ğŸ”½Monasteries were called palaces.
Temples were called observatories.
Bronze cymbals were banned.
The Buddha was given the robes of the Celestial Venerable.
Virtuous ones wore the robes of Daoists and wore crowns and held tablets.
Baozhao, the Great Master of Chongxian Xiangji Temple in the Left Street of the capital, wrote a memorial to remonstrate, saying:
Since ancient times, the Buddha Dharma has shared the rise and fall of the country's fortunes.
Emperor Taiwu of the Yuanwei Dynasty believed in Cui Hao and destroyed the Buddha Dharma.
In five or six years, Cui Hao's entire clan was exterminated.
Emperor Wencheng greatly promoted it.
Emperor Wu of the Zhou believed in Wei Zheng and destroyed Buddhism.
In six or seven years, Zheng was demoted and died.
Emperor Wen of the Sui Dynasty continued to promote it.
Emperor Wu of the Tang Dynasty believed in Li Deyu and Li Guizhen and destroyed Buddhism.
In less than a year, Guizhen was executed.
Deyu was exiled to Zhuya.
Emperor Xuanzong greatly promoted it.
Our state's Taizu Emperor and Taizong Emperor, the successive sages, translated scriptures, tested monks, and circulated the Buddha Dharma.
It has been established as a constitution for ten thousand generations to follow.
The emperor was furious and tattooed Yongdao in Daozhou.
Dao, while in exile, strictly observed the precepts as usual.
At that time, Dao had once received the esoteric mantra teachings from Tripiá¹­aka Master from the Western Regions.
At that time, many soldiers and civilians suffered from malaria.
Dao chanted water and made them drink it.
All of them fully recovered.
In the third month, there was a great flood in the capital, and the streets were vast.
The imperial court entrusted Lin Lingsu to manage the water.
The water overflowed day and night.
The ruler and ministers were worried. The monk Sengqia Puguang Wang of Sishou manifested his spirit in the palace.
The emperor burned incense and paid homage.
He saw Sengqia shaking his staff and climbing the city wall.
The water then suddenly dried up.
The ruler and ministers were greatly delighted.
In the winter of the eleventh month, Lin Lingsu was released to return to Wenzhou.
In the second year of Xuanhe, in the ninth month of autumn,
An edict was issued to restore the title of Buddha.
Virtuous monks were again allowed to be monks.
Yongdao was transferred to a nearby prefecture.
In the seventh year of Xuanhe, an edict ordered Yongdao to return to the capital and resume his monastic appearance and conduct.
The imperial court praised him for protecting the Dharma.
They appreciated his loyalty and integrity.
His name was changed to Fadao.
He resided at Zhaoxian Temple in Zhaoling,
And concurrently managed Xiansheng Shijia Temple in the right street.
The Liao state was attacked and captured by the Jin people in the fourth month.
Zuzhou on the road to the capital city was the Heavenly Kitchen Hall of the founding emperor.
In Huai Prefecture, it was the Chongyuan Hall of Emperor Taizong's virtue and light.
In Qing Prefecture, it was the three halls of Divine Appearance, Hoping for Immortality, and Hoping for Saints.
Previously, when the prefectures of Po, Qian, Xian, and others were conquered,
such as the Ning Shen Hall, the An Yuan Sheng Mu Hall, the Mu Ye Shan Shi Zu Dian, the imperial tombs, the shadow halls of the imperial concubines and princes,
they were burned and looted to the point of complete destruction, and gold, silver, pearls, and jade were excavated.
The authorities immediately reported this.
Xiao Fengxian all suppressed it and did not report it (Liao Zhi).

In the second year of Xuanhe, the gengzi year, the monks were restored and the title of Buddha was given again. In the tenth year of Tianqing in the Great Liao, the third year of Tianfu in the Great Jin, and the second year of Yuandong in the Western Xia, the Song's Chief Minister Chen Liangbi held a great assembly and invited Chan and lecture masters.
There was a Dharma Master Shan.
The lion of eloquence in the Huayan school was called the tiger of principles.
He asked the Chan masters, saying:
The Buddha's teachings range from the Lesser Vehicle to the Perfect and Sudden teachings.
They sweep away emptiness and existence, and only realize the eternal truth.
Only then is it called Buddhahood, adorned with myriad virtues.
Yet the Chan school claims that a single shout can transform an ordinary person into a sage.
Examining this against the sutras and treatises, it seems contradictory.
Now, if a single shout can enter the five teachings, it is considered correct.
If it cannot enter the five teachings, it is considered wrong.
At that time, the Chan masters were seated in rows.
Chan Master Fazhen Yigong blinked his eyes, and Chan Master Cishi Shengong elbowed Jinfu, the messenger of Ningguo Temple, to respond.
Jinfu called out to Shan and said,
I have heard the questions of the Dharma masters.
It is not necessary to trouble the great Chan masters to answer.
Only the small elder of Ningguo Temple can resolve the doubts of the Dharma masters.

As for the five teachings, the teaching for the foolish of the Lesser Vehicle has meaning.ğŸ”½The teaching of the beginning stage of the Great Vehicle is the meaning of emptiness.ğŸ”½The teaching of the final stage of the Great Vehicle is the meaning of neither existence nor emptiness.
The sudden teaching of the Great Vehicle is the meaning of both existence and emptiness.
It is called the One Vehicle Perfect Teaching, which is empty yet not existent, existent yet not empty. This one shout of mine is not only able to enter the five teachings,
but it can also enter all the various arts and crafts of the world.
Then he shouted.
Do you hear it or not?
Xuanze said, I hear it.
Chengguan said,
Since you hear it, then this one shout is existent.
It is able to enter the Lesser Vehicle teaching.
He then called out to Xuanze,
Do you hear it or not now?
Xuanze said, I do not hear it.
Chengguan said,
Since you do not hear it, then the previous one shout was non-existent.
It is able to enter the initial teaching of the Great Vehicle.
My first shout,
you said it was existent.
After the shout, the sound has long since dissipated.
You again say it is non-existent.
If you say it is non-existent, then originally it was existent.
If you say it is existent, then right now it is non-existent.
Since it is neither existent nor non-existent,
it is able to enter the final teaching.
When I have a shout,
existence is not existence.
Because of non-existence, there is existence.
When there is no shouting,
non-existence is not non-existence.
Because of existence, there is non-existence.
The ability to enter the sudden teaching lies in the simultaneity of existence and non-existence.
As for my single shout, I do not use it as a single shout.
Existence and non-existence are both inadequate, and conceptual understanding is completely forgotten.
When speaking of existence, not a single hair is established.
When speaking of non-existence, it pervades the entire universe.ğŸ”½This single shout enters into millions and billions of shouts.
Millions and billions of shouts enter into this single shout.
This is the ability to enter the perfect teaching.
SuÃ¬ bowed his head in thanks.
The master then called out to SuÃ¬, saying,
Even a single word, a single silence, a single movement, a single stillness,
The Way from ancient times to the present,
The ten directions of empty space, the myriad phenomena,
The six destinies and four forms of birth,
The buddhas of the three times, all sages and worthies,
The eighty-four thousand Dharma gates, the hundreds of thousands of samÄdhis,
The immeasurable wondrous meanings,ğŸ”½In accord with principle and in accord with the capacities of beings,
Unify with Heaven and Earth and the myriad things.
It is called the Dharma-body.
The three realms are only mind, the myriad dharmas are only consciousness.
The four seasons and eight nodes are in perfect harmony with the yin and yang.
It is called the Dharma-nature.
Therefore, the Huayan Sutra says:
The Dharma-nature pervades everywhere.
With form and without form, one sound, one color,
All contained within a single dust mote, encompassing the four meanings.
The boundless principle and phenomena pervade without exception.ğŸ”½Interpenetrating without mixing,
Blending without being one.
All are complete within this single shout.
This is still the gateway of transformation, the expedient means according to the capacity of the individual.
It is called a small resting place.
Not yet reaching the treasure site.
How could you know that in the lineage of our ancestral teachers, the mind is transmitted through the mind, the Dharma is sealed with the Dharma,
Without establishing written words, one sees one's nature and becomes a Buddha.
There is a supreme path that has not been transmitted by the thousand sages.
Shan again asked:
What is the supreme path?
Cheng said:
You should first understand it from below.
Shan said:
What is the treasure site?
Cheng said, It is not within your realm.
Shan said, I hope the Chan master will have compassion.
Cheng said, Even if the vast ocean changes, I will never reveal it to you.
Shan then changed his expression, lowered his head, and left.
At that time, the emperor secretly visited to observe.
The grand mentor, Duke of Lu, was also present.
The emperor looked at the attendants and said,
The Chan school's profundity and subtlety is so profound like this.
Even the eloquence of the abbot of Nengren is rarely seen.
The attendants reported,
This is merely the remainder of the Chan master's discourse.
Ying Zhongwen, the recorder of Laohu, wrote a praise saying,
Cheng's learning is extensive and clear, and his way is profound.
He encounters the origin on the left and right, and uses the opportunity to subdue the sharp points in front of the assembly of humans and gods.
Even if the ancient virtuous ones supported the school,
they would be unable to add to this.ğŸ”½The Chan master's name was Jicheng.
His courtesy name was Mian'an.
He was born in the Liu family of Yichun, Yuanzhou, Jiangxi.
He was ordered to reside at the Nengren Chan monastery.
The master succeeded Chan Master Zhihai Daoping.
Daoping succeeded Dayang Anyue.ğŸ”½Anyue succeeded Cuifeng Kewen.
Kewen succeeded Chan Master Ciming Shigui.
Cheng's disciples included two disciples.ğŸ”½They were Ruiyan Sheng and Yefu Chuan.
The Linji lineage. Luohu Wenji, Wudeng Huiyuan.

In the summer of the third year of Xuanhe in the Xin Chou year, Tong Guan presented the great master. The Great Liao, the first year of Baodai. The Great Jin, the fourth year of Tianfu. The Western Xia, the second month of the Song.
The edict ordered the restoration of the temples that were changed to Shenxiao Palaces in the seventh year of Zhenghe.
The fields and properties were all returned to the monks and temples. Tongji Ji.
On the twenty-fifth day of the third month, the edict summoned Chan Master Cishou Huisheng.
To reside at the Huilin Chan Monastery of the Great Xiangguo Temple in Bianjing.
The master was born in Shou County to the Xia family.
He passed away in the second year of Shaoxing in the Gaozong era.ğŸ”½He succeeded Changlu Qingliao.
Qingliao succeeded Huilin Yuanzhao Ben. Chan Master Puding. Pudeng Lu.
Baiyun Hermitage is located behind the abbot's quarters of Lingyin Temple in Hangzhou.
It was like this in the third year of the Xuanhe era.
There was a monk named Qingjiao.
He called himself Benran.
On the twenty-second day of the tenth month in the third year of the Qingli era of Emperor Renzong's reign,
he was born to the Kong family in Dengfeng County, Luoyang.
He was a fifty-second-generation descendant of Confucius.
His great-grandfather Gao Qiong served the Liang and Tang dynasties.
During the Tongguang era, he held the positions of military commissioner of Xiangzhou, Zezhou, and Heyang,
and eventually became the grand mentor to the crown prince.
His father Xin was a recluse with hidden virtues.
His mother was Lady Cui.
Jue was intelligent from a young age and studied Confucianism.
He repeatedly applied for the local examinations.
In the second year of the Xining era of Emperor Shenzong's reign,
he had an insight while reading the Lotus Sutra.
He sought to become a monk.
His parents gave their permission.
He had his head shaved by Master Haihui of Bao'en Temple on Mount Longmen in Ruzhou.
He was instructed to travel south to seek teachings.
He first visited the thousand-year-old monk of Mount Emei in Jiazhou.
Next, he arrived at Mount Fuzhou in Shu, Hubei, now Anqing Prefecture.
He built a hut on the cliff of the prefect's rock.
He sat in meditation for twenty years.
In the seventh year of the Yuanyou era of Emperor Zhezong, he traveled to Zhejiang.
The following year, he arrived at Lingyin Temple in Hangzhou and lived there with the assembly.
The two officials Wang and Luo sought the essence of the master's mind.
The number of his disciples increased daily.
Chan Master Yuanming Tong of Lingyin Temple.
He lived in the White Cloud Mountain Hermitage behind the temple.
He opened up the teaching of the mysterious transformation.
He then established his own school.
He named it the White Cloud School after the name of the hermitage where he lived.
He moved to Longmen Mountain in Yuhang.
The hermitage was called the Land of Blessings.
He taught the three refuges and five precepts to the dragons and spirits.
In the third year of the Chongning era,
he lived in the Purple Cloud Hermitage behind Kaihua Temple at the Six Harmonies Pagoda in Qiantang.
He was invited to lecture on the Huayan Sutra at Zhengji Temple.
At that time, the teaching was being destroyed.
Jue wrote the Treatise on Certifying the School, the Compilation of the Three Teachings, and the Song of the Ten Grounds.
In the first year of the Daguang era,
he built a hermitage in Qianjin market in Gui'an, Huzhou.
It was named Shidi.
Next, he arrived at Jing Mountain in Wucheng.
He obtained a spring and built a hermitage to live in.
It was named Chujin.
His disciples again invited him to return to Zhengji Temple.
Those who disliked him reported to the officials that he had offended the court with his Zhizong lun.
In the sixth year of the Zhenghe era, he was exiled to Sizhou in Guangnan.
In the second year of the Xuanhe era, ten disciples including Zheng Bu submitted a petition to the capital.
They were granted permission to leave as they pleased.
On the twenty-first day of the seventh month in the Xin Chou year, he expressed his gratitude.
On the third day of the eighth month, he wrote a verse and presented it to Prefect You.
He indicated that the twenty-sixth day of the ninth month would be their farewell.
On that day, he passed away.
He lived to the age of seventy-nine.
He had been a monk for fifty-two summers.
His disciple Huineng received his last instructions.
He carried the relics back to be buried on Nanshan in Yuhang, Hangzhou.
It was the second month of the fifth year of Xuanhe.
The stupa was called Baiyun.
The monastery was called Pu'an.
Later, the disciples changed it to Pu Ning.
At Chongde Zeng Mountain and Songlin Shan Zhizhu,
They were all places where he practiced the Way.
Deqing, Longshan, Chaoshan, Fangshan, Qianyuanshan, Gui'an, Yanshan,
They were all places where his relics were divided and buried.
His school flourished in the area south of the Zhe River.

In the Renyin year, the 5th year of Xuanhe, in the 12th month, the Layman Wuzhong passed away. In the 2nd year of Baodai in the Great Liao, the 5th year of Tianfu in the Great Jin, and the Western Xia, in the spring of the 3rd month,
The Jin people captured the Central Capital, the Xi country.
Tianzuo was in Yanjing and was very afraid when he heard the news.
On the same day, he left JÃ¼yong Pass.
Leading five thousand cavalry, he fled west to Yunzhong Prefecture.
He left the chief ministers Zhang Lin and Li Chuwen to guard Yan with Prince Chun of Yan.
Chun had been in Yan for twenty years and had won the hearts of the people.
Emperor Tianzuo fled to Yuyang and entered Jiashan.
Li Chuweng and others met with the officials and elders on the 17th day of the 3rd month.
They established Emperor Tianxi of the Yan Dynasty.
The era name was changed to Jianfu.
An edict was issued to depose Emperor Tianzuo as the King of Xiangyin.
Emperor Tianxi of the Yan Dynasty had pacified the six routes of Yan, Yun, Ping, Zhongjing, Shangjing, and Liaoxi, and annexed them as his own territory.
The various tribes of the Shamo Desert to the north, southwest, and northwest routes of the Zhaotaofu were under the rule of Emperor Tianzuo.
He was called the second year of Baodai.
From this point on, the Liao state was divided.
In the 8th month, Emperor Chun of Yan died.
He was given the posthumous title of Emperor Xuan.
He had no heir.
King Xiao Gan of Yue met with the officials and elders.
They discussed establishing the wife of Emperor Yan as the Empress Dowager.
She had authority over military and state affairs.
She welcomed the second son of Emperor Tianzuo, King Qin, as emperor.
Empress Xiao ascended the throne at the coffin.
Previously, the era name was changed to Dexing.
Emperor Tianzuo heard of Chun's death.
Below, an edict was issued to reduce Chun's official rank and title.
And his wife Xiao was demoted to commoner status.
He was granted the surname Hui.
The Jin ruler rushed to the Central Capital.
Tianzuo fled to the Xia state.
In the twelfth month, the Jin people reached the JÃ¼yung Pass.

In the 5th year of Xuanhe, the 3rd year of Baodai of the Great Liao, in the 5th month, the Great Jin changed the era name to the first year of Tianhui, the Western Xia. In the spring, there was a drought in Suzhou (now Jiaxinglu).
Prayers were made at Jingyan Temple to Guanyin, and there were miraculous responses.
The sacred image was refurbished.
In the summer, there was another drought, and lectures were held again.
The prefect Zeng Hou dreamed of a white-robed celestial being who said:
I should indeed bring rain to this region.
But my face is unclean, and I cannot see anything within thirty li.
How can I join the assembly of sages?
The next day, he inquired about the reason.
Sure enough, the craftsmen wanted to brighten the sacred countenance.
They used chicken eggs, ox glue, and mixed powder, so it was like that.
So it was renovated.
The Record of the Ages says: AvalokiteÅ›vara's Responsive Manifestations.
In the spring of the first month of the Liao dynasty,
the Empress Xiao of the Yan Emperor was in Yan.
She heard that the Jin people entered Gu'an Pass.
At night, she led Xiao Gan and the carriages and tents out of the city.
She shouted to welcome the enemy.
In reality, she was fleeing.
She arrived at Songting Pass and discussed where to go.
YelÃ¼ Dashi, a Liao person,
wanted to return to Emperor Tianzuo.
The Four Armies' Great King Xiao Gan, a Xi person,
wanted to establish a country by setting up the Xi Wangfu.
Xuanzong, the Yan Emperor Chun, and the Cavalry General Xiao Bode said,
Today, we should indeed return to Emperor Tianzuo.
However, what face do we have to see him?
Lin Ya ordered his attendants to drag him out and behead him.
He issued an order that anyone in the army who dared to have a different opinion would be beheaded.
Thus, the Liao and Xi armies lined up in battle formations and divided.
The Liao army, following Lin Ya, escorted Empress Xiao back to Emperor Tianzuo at Jiashan, arriving at Jiashan in the seventh month.
Tianzuo ordered Empress Xiao and her nephew Changge to be killed.
The rest were pardoned of their original crimes.
The naval forces of the Xi and Bohai followed Xiao Gan's name Kui Li and did not leave the Xi Wangfu.
Gan occupied the prefecture and established himself, usurping the title of Divine and Sacred Emperor.
The country was called Great Xi.
The reign era was changed to Tianxing, and again to Tiansi.
In the seventh month, Xi troops encountered the Jin people in battle at Waist-covering.
The Xi suffered a great defeat.
Xiao Gan was killed by his subordinate Dege. Liao Zhizhe.
In the spring of the Jin Dynasty's Guimao year,
The emperor's camp was promoted and called Huining Prefecture.
It was established as the Upper Capital.
The Liao's Upper Capital was changed to Beijing.
Previously, the Jurchen had no walled cities.
They only called them the emperor's camp, the prime minister's camp, and the prince's camp.
It was changed here.
Three ministries, six prefects, two offices, and subordinate agencies were established.
The Left Chancellor Chen Wang Wushi compiled the Jurchen characters and circulated the Jin Annals.
In the fifth month, Aguda Min.
In the north, he pursued Tianzuo on the way and died of illness.
He was given the posthumous title of Great Sage Martial Yuan Emperor.
The temple name was Taizu.
Min established the country and ascended the throne, a total of six years.
His younger brother Wu Qima established.
Changed his name to Sheng.
The second son of Yang Ge Taishi.
Changed Tianfu six years to Tianhui first year.
He reigned for eleven years.
Min had eight sons, all enfeoffed as kings.
Originally, Zhang Qi of Yan was a person from Pingzhou. Pingluanzhou in Hedong and Xishan Dao are all ancient Pingzhou.
He ascended the military rank and served Yan.
In the first year of Jianfu, the year of Yan Wang Chun's reign.
The Renyin year. He was appointed Jiedushi of Xingjun of Liao (Liao and Jun are Pingzhou).
The Jin man Nianhan wanted to capture Qi.
Kang Gong Bi said.
This is to encourage their return.
Alone he went to see Yuan Hao, conveying the intention of the Jin state.
Yuan Hao said:
Only the eight roads of the Khitan, now Pyeongju, remain.
Dare there be any different intentions?
The reason we have not yet released our armor is to guard against Xiao Gan.
Kang reported his words.
Nianhan believed it.
He changed Pyeongju to Nanjing.
He added Yuan Hao as a co-chancellor and judge of the garrison.
The fact is that he wanted to plot against them.
Yuan Hao killed Jin Zuo Qibow and others.
And attached Pyeongju to Song.
In the eleventh month, the Jin army attacked and broke through Pyeongju.
They obtained the golden flower letter and imperial brush writing bestowed by the Song court. Jin then returned to Song.
Consecutive edicts were sent to the Song court's Xuanfu Office to take Yuan Hao.
Song had no choice but to
order Wang Anzhong to execute Yuan Hao.
The head was sent to Jin in a box.
Before long, Jin's crown prince Wolibu invaded Song from Pyeongju. Jin zhi.
The Jin lord Min had eight sons.
The first was called Amu.
The second was called Shihe, the father of Zongzhou.
The third was called Shuliang Hu.
He was of the same mother as Shihe.
He was born to the main wife.ğŸ”½The fourth was called Wolibu (mispronounced as Er Taizi).
The fifth was called Wali (mispronounced as San Taizi).
He was born in the winter of the fourth year of Shaoxing in the Song Dynasty, invading the upper reaches of the Jiang River.
The sixth was called Wuzhu (mispronounced as Si Taizi).
The seventh was called Wali (mispronounced as Wu Taizi).
The eighth was called Aguobao (mispronounced as Langjun), the king of Zizai, who was of the same mother as Wuzhu. The second and third sons of Min died young.
Therefore, the fourth was mispronounced as the second,
the fifth as the third,
and the sixth as the fourth. The Records of the Jin Dynasty.

Jiachen, the sixth year of Xuanhe, the fourth year of Baodai in the Great Liao, the second year of Tianhui in the Great Jin, the second year of the Western Xia. The Venerable Jizhong of the Song Dynasty, Chan Master Qingliang of Ruizhou, Jiangxi.
Named Huixiong, also named Dehong.
The son of the Peng family of the prefecture.
At the age of fourteen, both his parents passed away.
He lived with Chan Master Sanfeng Yan.
He wrote several thousand words a day.
He read almost all the books.
Yan appreciated him.
At the age of nineteen, he took the sutra examination at Tianwang Temple in the Eastern Capital and received the full ordination.
